Tristan Muniz
Hi Dragos, yes I am

I actually look usage but it is hard sometime to tell how useful the output was, so your feedback would be greatly appreciated

Tristan Muniz
Great, will do. Do you have any examples on how you guys have been using it differently than gpt?

Tristan Muniz
Also is there a way of using an assistant in it or is it just chatgpt?

one example is when you would go to a GPT but you would have to explain a lot of things in order for it to do the work, and those things are things you've seen but it takes time to stitch them or write them down

as it would act as a vanilla GPT/Claude but with access to those things you've seen and are in your mind

another example, is to scan your history ... eg what did X have to say about Y? what progress did I review with X last week? what is the document that was talking about?

windows.title: Product Change Specs / ProductMind / Amazon Q Business - Teardown

uiElements.details: interface with sidebar and document view.

content.title: Document Content
content.visibleText: Q Business Pros Can ingest large volumes of data from a bunch of different sources Allows mixing/merging data from various different data sources This enables configuring the retriever outcome by using tags/metadata List the sources that it used, including the option to include the original data source Has the concept of Q Apps to bundle and chain prompts and create complex workflows Q Business Cons Can't control the LLM that's used under the good to generate queries Can't control the retriever to select how many results it brings back The first two combined generally yield poorer-quality responses Q Apps are one shot - one or more inputs, one or more outputs, anything that the AI gets wrong you can't guide through and fix It doesn't offer APIs to access the KB/index directly for retrieval tasks Quality Assessment Q Business - RAG and Output Quality Comparison Recommendation Do not use AWS Q Business as a replacement for Stack-AI to build knowledge bases Investigate Knowledge Bases for Amazon Bedrock, which seems to be a better fit Screenshots

activitySummary: The user is engaged in a Google Meet video conference, as evidenced by the screenshot showing multiple participants, including Simon Said, Serban Petrescu, Tim Jones, Dmitry Bakaev, Bogdan Tenea, Samy Aboel-Nil, Isaac Squires, and Dragos Nută. The meeting appears to be active, with participants discussing various topics. The user is also simultaneously viewing a 'Threads' page on cloud.getliteral.ai, which lists various tasks and requests related to AI assistance, such as crafting email replies and generating follow-up emails.

The user is actively chatting with Tristan Muniz on Google Chat. The conversation revolves around the usage and effectiveness of AI tools, specifically comparing GPT and Claude. Tristan Muniz is asking for examples of how the AI tools are being used differently and whether there is a way to use an assistant within the tool. The user provides detailed explanations and examples, indicating a deep engagement in discussing AI tool functionalities and their practical applications.

The user is reviewing a document on Notion titled 'Amazon Q Business - Teardown.' The document outlines the pros and cons of Q Business, including its ability to ingest large volumes of data, mix data from various sources, and configure retriever outcomes using tags and metadata. The document also discusses the limitations of Q Business, such as the inability to control the LLM used for generating queries and the lack of APIs for direct retrieval tasks. The user is likely analyzing this information to make informed decisions about using Q Business for their projects.

During the Google Meet video conference, Bogdan Tenea is presenting a document. The presentation appears to be related to the 'Amazon Q Business - Teardown' document the user was reviewing earlier. This indicates that the meeting is focused on discussing the findings and recommendations from the document, such as not using AWS Q Business as a replacement for Stack-AI and investigating Knowledge Bases for Amazon Bedrock. The user is actively participating in this discussion, as evidenced by their presence in the meeting and the simultaneous review of the document.
aiUseSummary: The user utilizes AI tools primarily for generating email replies and follow-up emails, as seen in the 'Threads' page on cloud.getliteral.ai. They also engage in detailed discussions about the usage and effectiveness of AI tools, specifically comparing GPT and Claude, and exploring the potential of using an assistant within these tools. The user provides examples of how AI can scan history and provide context-aware responses, indicating a strategic use of AI to enhance productivity and task efficiency.
